Docs.summary: Gets the discovery mode for the endpoint.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Discovery can be accomplished in two different modes: Ad-Hoc or Managed. For more information, see [WCF Discovery Overview](/dotnet/framework/wcf/feature-details/wcf-discovery-overview)

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property DiscoveryVersion As DiscoveryVersion
public: property TimeSpan MaxResponseDelay { TimeSpan get(); void set(TimeSpan value); };
member this.MaxResponseDelay : TimeSpan with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the maximum within which all of the for a service that respond to a probe operation are sent.
Docs.value: A instance that contains the maximum time span within which all of the for a service that respond to a probe operation are sent.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This value is a <xref:System.TimeSpan> that specifies a time span in which all `ProbeMatches` for a service that respond to a single probe operation are sent. If all `ProbeMatches` are sent at the same time, a network storm may result. To prevent this from occurring, `ProbeMatches` are sent with a random delay between each ProbeMatch. The random delay is in the range of 0 to <xref:System.ServiceModel.Discovery.DiscoveryEndpoint.MaxResponseDelay%2A>. If <xref:System.ServiceModel.Discovery.DiscoveryEndpoint.MaxResponseDelay%2A> is set to 0, then the `ProbeMatches` messages are sent in a tight loop without any delay. Otherwise, the `ProbeMatches` messages are sent with some random delay such that the total time taken to send all `ProbeMatches` messages does not exceed the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Discovery.DiscoveryEndpoint.MaxResponseDelay%2A>. This value is only relevant for services, it is not used by clients.
